speco.array

Interface Resizer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FibonacciResizer

    public interface Resizer

    Title: Resizer

    Description: An array resizer. Controls the underline buffer of an array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object add(java.lang.Object buffer)
      Adds a new component to the Array's buffer (resizes it if required)
      default java.lang.Object alloc()
      Creates a buffer of the current buffer size
      default java.lang.Object alloc(java.lang.Class<?> cl)
      Creates a buffer of the current buffer size
      int buffer_size()
      Gets the size of the buffer of the Array
      default java.lang.Object clear()
      Restart the array size manager
      default java.lang.Object copy(java.lang.Object buffer, int n)
      Creates a shallow copy of the first n elements of the Array's buffer
      java.lang.Object del(java.lang.Object buffer)
      Removes a component from the Array's buffer (resizes it if required)
      java.lang.Object init(java.lang.Class<?> cl, int n)
      Initializes an Array Size manager to the given size of the Array
      default java.lang.Object init(int n)
      Initializes an Array Size manager to the given size of the Array
      int size()
      Gets the size of elements of the Array

        default java.lang.Object clear()
        Restart the array size manager
        Returns:

        java.lang.Object init(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                      int n)
        Initializes an Array Size manager to the given size of the Array
        Parameters:
        cl - Class of the Array's elements
        n - Size of the array
        Returns:
        Inner Array's buffer

      • add

        java.lang.Object add(java.lang.Object buffer)
        Adds a new component to the Array's buffer (resizes it if required)
        Parameters:
        buffer - Current Array's buffer
        Returns:
        A new buffer for the Array if required. The same buffer otherwise

      • del

        java.lang.Object del(java.lang.Object buffer)
        Removes a component from the Array's buffer (resizes it if required)
        Parameters:
        buffer - Current Array's buffer
        Returns:
        A new buffer for the Array if required. The same buffer otherwise

      • alloc

        default java.lang.Object alloc()
        Creates a buffer of the current buffer size
        Returns:
        A buffer of elements with the same size of the Array's buffer

      • alloc

        default java.lang.Object alloc(java.lang.Class<?> cl)
        Creates a buffer of the current buffer size
        Parameters:
        cl - Class of the Array's elements
        Returns:
        A buffer of elements with the same size of the Array's buffer

      • copy

        default java.lang.Object copy(java.lang.Object buffer,
                              int n)
        Creates a shallow copy of the first n elements of the Array's buffer
        Parameters:
        buffer - Current Array's buffer
        n - Number of elements to copy
        Returns:
        A buffer of the current Array's buffer with a shallow copy of the first n elements in the Array's buffer
